ratings.comment: Prof Soskova was a tough but good professor for 571. You can tell that she knows her material. If you ask for help, she will find ways to make the material easier to understand or approach. She had a very good grading scale, with homework worth 40%, and very hard to score poorly on homework. She also had us do a group project worth 10% of our grade

Absolutely one of the worst teachers I have ever had. She was consistently behind in material. She had inconsistent and sloppy handwriting. She didn't use a microphone so it was difficult to understand her. She moved too fast on problems that weren't important and spent too much time on one's that weren't. She taught material that wasn't on final.

I wasn't thrilled w/ Soskova's teaching. She moves too quickly through lectures and she teaches in a way that does not align with how problems should be solved. My TA taught me more than she did. Her handwriting is also terrible. She is a nice professor and not the worst but not great. You will be fine if you take her but you have to work hard!

Prof. Soskova doesn't deserve that awful rating she has. Her lectures are kind of boring and her handwriting can be hard to read sometimes, but she presented all the information that we needed during lectures. All in all, she's a fair professor, making her a better option that most in the awful-teaching UW Math Department.

Her hand writing is near impossible to read and she never explains the work she is showing. You get completely lost the second she starts a problem. I had a sub for two weeks in her class and learned perfectly in those two weeks. As soon as she came back, lost. Solidifies that she is the problem.
Please save yourself and do not take a class with this professor. I can confidently say she is the worst math instructor I have had in the entirety of my education.

Prof Sokova is pretty understanding, especially about covid. She has shortened quizzes, added time to take quizzes, comprised Honorlock for the students benefit. I never felt that I had to read the textbook but the video notes were very handy.

She gives us problems and solutions to that problem and doesn't clarify how sad solution is a solution of all problems of that type. It's never clear what is important and what is not and as a result, it takes lots of trial and error to teach yourself what's important and what applies.

Mariya is an excellent professor online, much better than the others in her department in this format from what I've heard. There is a light amount of homework and a test each week, but with even just a little effort you will stay on top of it. Great professor!

She cares about every question you asked. I receive a lot from her classes. She replies to all the emails you sent and considered your situation. It is nice to have her this semester, so I intend to meet with her next year.

Her teaching is sub-par at best. However, there is no denying that she cares a lot about her class. This class is very homework and worksheet based. I found attending discussion was more productive than attending lectures. This class doesn't deserve the bad rep it gets.
It's a great time to take a nap in her class, not that you can help it. Good luck deciphering her handwriting.

I did fall asleep during most in person lectures, however when I was awake she gave a lot of good examples and gave good review sessions before tests. May not be the best professor however after talking to some of my friends with other profs, she definitely is not the worst.

You can tell that shes caring so this rating kinda hurts but bruh she don't know what shes doing. She speeds through lecture and makes mistakes all the time. Also the exams don't match what she gives us for practice/past exams. It's kind of like whats the point of giving us this material to study if the exam doesn't look like it?

Her lectures aren't clear or engaging and she makes a lot of mistakes during lectures. She's a nice enough person if you go to her office hours but she is not good at teaching. I figured I'd take this class with her because "it wouldn't be that bad." I was wrong. It is that bad.

I honestly don't know how she's even teaching the material. During lectures, she goes over the material as if we know everything in advance... she reads off her notes with an abundant amount of typos and wrong theorems. If you ask a question, she can't answer. Even if you show up to all lectures, you still gon' die on the tests. DO NOT HAVE HER!!!!

Professor Soskova does not explain any of the work that she is doing. She will cruise along the entire lecture and not slow down for anyone. In math, it is very beneficial for professors to explain WHY they are doing certain things throughout a problem. Professor Soskova will not slow down for people to take notes, she is in her own world.

Professor Soskova gives examples in class but she doesn't explain any of her steps nor does she give enough time for the student to copy down the examples. Her handwriting is very hard to read, making her examples that much worse. I would not recommend taking her lectures.

She lectures more or less straight from the book but the homework is almost impossible. You are expected to write out these lengthy proofs without the necessary information. It is normal to not understand most of what is going on and to not be able to do the homework without going to her office hours. Her class if frustrating and a lot of work.

Her name is Mariya, not Mayria. Her lectures were indeed boring and she didn't do a good job of being interactive or making sure people were following (which they didn't.) HOWEVER, her expectations were very clear. Her exams were not that difficult and they were modeled closely on HW problems. Her course is not awful, it just needs self-studying.

Mayria may be nice but is not good at her job. Lectures will put you to sleep even after a 5 hour energy mid class (true story) because she talks so slow and expects you to understand the arbitrary definitions she puts on the board. No practice tests or advance info on exams, and worthless homework. Get ready to search for linear algebra online!
Extremely boring and dry lecture even for math.  Ended up reading the textbook to learn all the material.
Terrible professor. I've had some bad math professors, but she was the worst. Uninspiring lectures and she teaches straight from the textbook (which is awful). I should've taken a different class.

She teaches pretty much straight from the book, and I never really understood what we were learning in class. Lectures were extremely boring. The exams were average in difficulty, and similar to the practice problems that she provides. Overall an average prof for a pretty boring class.

She's alright and nice enough.  Probably the best math professor I've had at UW Madison so far (but that's not saying much).  She explains stuff and gives good examples, but pretty much everything is right from the textbook.  This means that a lot of her explanations use a lot of arbitrary symbols and she doesn't explain clearly what they mean.

This prof is terrible. boring . tedious. Never take her again! Most importantly! she wont answer ur question in class. Her lecture is confusing. You can defintely learn better by reading textbook by yourself! I can say few can understand what She is teaching!
